results.title: Effects of exercise, metformin and their combination on glucose metabolism in individuals with abnormal glycaemic control: a systematic review and network meta-analysis.

results.title: Metformin mitigates gas explosion-induced blast lung injuries through AMPK-mediated energy metabolism and NOX2-related oxidation pathway in rats
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were randomly divided into three groups (n=30/group) as follows: Control group, @<m>DISEASE_Disruptive_Impulse_Control_and_Conduct_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007174 @@@gas explosion injury@@@ (BLI) group and @<m>DISEASE_Disruptive_Impulse_Control_and_Conduct_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007174 @@@gas explosion injury@@@ + @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (BLI + @GENE_MET @GENE_24553 @@@MET@@@) group.

citations.NLM: Zhang M, Sun Y, Ding C, Hong S, Li N, Guan Y, Zhang L, Dong X, Cao J, Yao W, Ren W, Yao S. Metformin mitigates gas explosion-induced blast lung injuries through AMPK-mediated energy metabolism and NOX2-related oxidation pathway in rats Exp Ther Med. 2022 Aug;24(2):529. PMID: 35837050

results.title: Reversible severe deterioration of glycaemic control after withdrawal of metformin treatment.
results.text_hl: Reversible severe @<m>DISEASE_Disruptive_Impulse_Control_and_Conduct_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007174 @@@deterioration of glycaemic control@@@ after withdrawal of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment.

results.title: Survey of antiobesity drug prescribing for obese children and young people in UK primary care
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Orlistat @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077403 @@@Orlistat@@@ was largely prescribed in those over 16 years of age without physical comorbidities. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ was initiated for treatment of @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovarian syndrome@@@ (70%), @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@insulin resistance@@@ (25%) and @<m>DISEASE_Disruptive_Impulse_Control_and_Conduct_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007174 @@@impaired glucose control@@@ (9%).

citations.NLM: White B, Hsia Y, Kinra S, Saxena S, Christie D, Viner RM, Wong ICK. Survey of antiobesity drug prescribing for obese children and young people in UK primary care BMJ Paediatr Open. 2017;1(1):e000104. PMID: 29637133
